Quick search

Test functions for (global) optimization problems (test_functions)¶

Following test-functions implemented: Parabola, NoisyParabola, Rosenbrock, Fourmin, Schwefel, Camel, GenzFunction1. Each has f, df, ddf function members for value, derivative and Hessian; xmin, xmax describing domain (in each dimension); xopt location of optimum, fopt value of optimum.

Bases: vkikriging.test_functions.TestFunction

Six-hump camel-back test function in 2-d.

class vkikriging.test_functions.Parabola(d=2)[source]¶

Bases: vkikriging.test_functions.TestFunction

Parabola, in d-dimensions. Minimum of 0 at 0 (given +ve def A).

f(x) = 0.5 * x^T A x

class vkikriging.test_functions.TestFunction[source]¶

Bases: object

vkikriging.test_functions.plot_derivativetest(testfn)[source]¶

DEBUGGING CODE: Verify derivatives and Hessians implemented above by comparing the full function with it’s 3-term Taylor expansion. These are plotted along a line, and should agree with each other close to x0, the point at which the expansion is made.

vkikriging.test_functions.plot_testfunction(testfn)[source]¶

Contour plot of 2d test-function f.
